Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. Hey, champions.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Quater finals in an hour. Hope you got some sleep cause I am going to be haunting your nightmares tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I did. I got some really good sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Did you? [pushes pencil cup at Erin]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [grabs pencils out of cup quickly as cup falls] Bzzz.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yesterday was the first round of a branch wide paper airplane contest. It was being sponsored by Weyer-Hammer Paper in an effort to get us to sell more of their new product Airstream Deluxe A4, the Cadillac of paper. It's not so easy on the environment, if you know what I mean. [whispers] Practically made of plastic.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: We started with sixteen brave aviators. Some use skill [cut to Kevin flying paper airplane], others relied on showmanship [cut to Dwight throwing airplane at Nate with an apple on his head] others seem not to comprehend what a paper airplane is. [cut to Creed throwing a melon] And of course, there was the odd moment of heartbreak and disaster.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey I left my glasses down here somewhere. Crossing through, beep beep. [Pam's plane hit Toby in the eye]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ow! Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I didn't see you! You should have yelled "Crossing!"

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [crying] I'm sorry!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, so is that my spot?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: We are now down to an elite eight. Well, seven and Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Reading from script] Be careful of that beaker, it contains dangerous acid!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It does not say dangerous. And there's no exclamation point.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well I'm just trying to bring some life to it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Last week I got an agent and uh, this week I got a movie. HRPDC chemical handling protocols. It's gonna be seen by tons of workers in the industrial chemical community. One of whom could have a cousin whose brother's Brad Pitt. And boom, next thing you know, I'm in Moneyballs Two.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go away, we're running lines.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You wanted to see the gooey eye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. Alright, get over here. I am so freaked out by things going into eyes. I just- wow. [moves to lift Toby's eye patch] Uggggh! I can't even, I'm so freaked out by that, just go. Go go go go go.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright, it's getting gooier so we'll just do it later.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, Ok. [Closes door] Alright. Where were we?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Something full of acid.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And remember: Do not attempt to extinguish a chemical fire with water. You will only exacerbate the flame. The dangerous flame.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [claps] That was great man. Alright, I'm out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: W-w-w-wait. Stop stop stop. Don't go anywhere. I just need to find more colors. Let's do it six more times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. I just wanted to say that you woke up early with the kids and let me sleep and I really appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. I appreciate that you appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, we had couple's therapy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No shame in that. Get it all out in the open.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we have homework.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, we are supposed to look for every chance to acknowledge and appreciate each other's sacrifices. Because I need to appreciate what Pam's been doing to run the house while I'm in Philly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we're also supposed to speak our truths.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmhm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because if I had spoken my truth sooner about not wanting to move to Philly, then maybe we wouldn't have had this opportunity for couple's therapy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, we're supposed to call everything we don't want to do "opportunities."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Heads up everyone. If you really need something from me today, let's get it done tomorrow. Carla Fern got me a gig.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Who's Carla Fern?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who is Carla Fern? Well, wow. Uh, she's my agent and my drill sargent. And one of my best friends. Oh, and Oscar, I already figured it out. If I have to get emotional in the film, I'm just going to think about you getting dumped by the Senator.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why wouldn't you use your own life? Erin just dumped you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Little raw. Not cool Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: But you just!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not cool.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hey. Day two. Drama in the warehouse skies. This is Robert from Weyer-Hammer Paper, who will be joining us to judge the final rounds.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Who's pumped for the quarter finals, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm pumped!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Clark's a dead man.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Alright. Sounds like somebody wants to walk away with this. [holds up large check for $2,000]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nellie you didn't tell us we could win money.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh yes I did, I told you all. It was..um, cause that's an awful lot of money for me to forget.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not one of us remembers you saying anything about two thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I forgot. I completely forgot. But at least now that large piece of cardboard that man was carrying around makes sense.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nellie, this is a competition. Please take it seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh please. [Dwight watches Angela folding paper airplane]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Me? Oh, I'm fine. I mean, sure, times are leaner now that I'm separated from the Senator. But my new studio apartment is just fine [camera shows small cluttered space with excessive cats and Phillip crying] for me.. and Phillip... and Tinky... and Crinklepuss, and Bandit 2, and Pawlick Baggins, and Lady Aragorn and their 10 kittens.

Quote.Speaker: Phillip
Quote.Text: [cries]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come here, come here. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I had a chance with Dwight, but I didn't take it. And if I went back now, when I'm broke and he just inherited a farm, I'd be one of those gold-digging tramps you read about that try to bag a farmer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I offered myself to Angela and she turned me down. If she changes her mind, the next move is hers. I'm with Esther now. She's younger than Angela, sturdier, more comfortable with the scent of a manured field. Let's be honest. When it came to manured fields, Angela was at best indifferent.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Oh, wide wings, interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey. Why don't you back off?[looks at Pete]...I mean best of luck to you in the competition.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Growing up in an orphanage, you have to fight other kids. For everything. Snacks, pillows, parents. I'm kinda worried about Pete seeing that side of me. I once ripped greedy Susan's pigtail right off her head. Just for a handful of Crispix.

Quote.Speaker: Carla Fern
Quote.Text: Are you in that paper documentary too?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Carla Fern
Quote.Text: Do you need an agent?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. He's- I mean, you've never acted in anything before. He's just my entourage.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I was in The Whiz in high school.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's the cleaky clacker! He clicks that and then the guy says "action."

Quote.Speaker: Carla Fern
Quote.Text: Hey, I made them get you a chair. All my clients sit.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Can I take your picture?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I guess it's starting. Um, yeah. Of course. Yeah sure. Tell you what. I'll put my arm around you and then I can take it-

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: We just need a picture of the top of your head in case we burn some of your hair off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Got it. [lowers head to show hair, but keeps looking up just as she tries to take the picture]

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: No, if you could just keep it down until..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: OK, next up we have two creatures great and small. Kevin versus Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, that is a really nice plane. You make that yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, what am I thinking? Of course you made that yourself. Cause it's in the rules that you have to fold your own plane.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Kevin, did you make that yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes. In a way. From one that I bought on Craigslist.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I call for a refold!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really? [to Dwight] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is flatter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a piece of paper. You fold it into an airplane.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ok, that's enough. This is the end of the ring now. You have to pick one.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't. I love them all too much. And, none of them fly. So that makes it harder.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You have to choose one now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Fine. [throws plane, doesn't fly]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Angela advances.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clapping] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Was Dwight rooting for me? Hmm. I hadn't noticed.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not giving up. I'm going to keep making planes until one of them flies. Like Wilbur and Orville Redenbacher.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: An Earl Grey tea for the lady.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. I acknowledge and appreciate that you went out of your way to get me tea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. I like being appreciated. But, to speak my truth, it wasn't out of the way because I felt like a tea anyway. So, one trip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, to speak my truth, I switched to coffee in March. There's a new espresso machine. But I still acknowledge and appreciate the gesture.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: We are rolling and...action!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Happily] This video is to demonstrate the HPRDC chemical handling protocols. These protocols could save you from severe injury, even death.

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: Ok, um, stop. Um, why are you smiling so much?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just made a character choice to be a scientist who really likes what he does and enjoys his job.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Ok, well maybe no smiling on this one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So how do you want, how should I do it?

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: I don't know, just like you're reporting the news or something. Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [ridiculous news voice] This video is to demonstrate the HPRDC chemical handling protocols.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's Tom Brokaw, it's a newscaster.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Who was that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tom Brokaw!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on Clark!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come on Clark. [Clark throws plane, Erin throws plane it goes much farther]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah! Oh! Eat it piggy! Eat it! Oink oink oink oink!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: We've still gotta work together, so we should keep it civil.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Snorts and grunts] I can't hear what you said. [snorting, grunting] You got your slop? [Squeals]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You know what, this is completely unnecessary. You already won...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Erin! Erin! Just stop.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Relax.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Next up we have Dwight and Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: You can do it baby!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No you can't baby! [to Dwight, whispers] Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watch and learn.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight defeats Phyllis, Dwight you are through to the semi-finals.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, Esther.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you- [Esther kisses him] You're here early.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Yeah, I plucked the chickens extra fast cause I knew I was seeing you tonight. There might just be a little feather in your nuggets or a little bit of meat inside of your pillow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like a little feather in my nuggets. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Alright ladies and gentlemen, we are down to the final four. Dwight, Erin, Angela and god only knows how, but Toby. One of you will walk away with two thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Ok here you have just knocked over the beaker, the chemicals splashed in your eye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which is insanely painful.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And I've already picked a few childhood memories to tap in to, to really express that pain.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: That's great. So what you're gonna do then is come over here to the eye washing station and then just kinda flush out your eyes. You know, get the chemicals out. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So I just lean over this thing and then you'll add the water special effect later?

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: What water special effect?

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah just hold your lids open with one hand and let the stream bathe your eyeballs.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not comfortable doing my own stunts. I'll get nude if you want me to, I'll go full Lena Dunham but I-

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Dude, we don't need you to go nude, OK? So just do the eyewash, Ok? That's all we're asking.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Darryl, what do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hold up, I'm looking at my spit with a microscope.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They want me to use real water in the eye wash scene.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can't squirt stuff in my eyeball. I've never even used an eye dropper.

Quote.Speaker: Production Assistant
Quote.Text: So Andy, so you know how to use this. You step on the pedal, water squirts in your eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Carla! Carla!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It is time for a little T & A. I give you: Toby and Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [throws plane far] Oh my god! Oh my god. Ok it's your turn. [Toby crumples plane and steps aside.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, Angela is the winner.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Is there a reason that we're excited for that little woman?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. I pity her. She was recently in a situation where she could have had it all, and instead she lost everything.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Oh. Is she a gambler?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In a way. But not in a stand up and cheer kind of way, like the song.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Hmm. That is sad.

Quote.Speaker: Carla Fern
Quote.Text: [grabs Andy by the cheeks] Andy! If you don't stick your eyes in that machine, I'm going to call every production in North Eastern Pennsylvania. You won't even make an appearance on a security camera! [Andy starts to cry]

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: What's the hold up here?

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: The actor's crying.

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: Oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She yelled at me. I can't wash my eyeball. I can't do that. I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard can't squirt water in his eye and act like it doesn't freak him out. But you know who can? Older Male Lab Assistant Number One.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you believe in me?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I believe I want to go home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throws plane far] Yeah! Ok! Beat that! [Erin throws plane, loses, Dwight laughs] Whoo! Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dammit! Dammit, god. [To Pete] Sorry. Yeah I'm fine. I'm fine. I got mad. Cause I don't like losing. I'm just gonna- Sorry I'm mad! I'm mad, I'm really mad. I wanted to win. We were gonna win a lot of money, I was gonna buy you a sweater. It's stupid. Just the whole contest is stupid. That's how it feels.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Erin kicks box] Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry I'm mad! I don't like losing! I thought I was going to win!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Ok [tries to help her] Hey hey hey, whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry. Sorry. I'm going to go upstairs and just...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I made us a date to take my mom out to dinner to thank her for all that extra babysitting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know how much I appreciate the opportunity to hang out with your mom more. So let me just put this in my calendar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I acknowledge with gratitude that you are being kind and responsible enough to include it in your calendar.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. Your mom is a treasure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I appreciate that some opportunities can be unpleasant- [Jim's phone rings, he answers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey that's work, hold on. Hey Wade, did Cole Hamels call back or what? Great. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, to speak my truth, I'd appreciate if you hung that up cause we were in the middle of a conversation. [Jim hangs up phone] I appreciate the sacrifice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok to speak my truth, that was a little sarcastic. I think that's a little unfair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? I've been putting the kids to bed by myself every night for a months. And you had to miss one phone call. Is that your truth, Jim? That's really your truth?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I guess I will swallow my truth.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Are you guys high? Because if so, to speak my truth, I would appreciate the sacrifice of including me in some hits off your kind buds.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not high.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wish we'd started this exercise six months ago. My heart just feels so... blocked up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The Mark 47 is ready for launch. [throws plane but it sticks to his hand] Less paste.

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: Here we go. Rolling and... action!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [doing eyewash] AHHH! AHHH! AHHH! AHHH!!

Quote.Speaker: Director
Quote.Text: And cut. We can fix the sound in post.

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can do a better one.

Quote.Speaker: Producer
Quote.Text: That's fine, we'll move on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I said I can do a better one. Darryl...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Action!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [eyewashes again] AHH! AHH! AHH!

Quote.Speaker: Carla Fern
Quote.Text: Kid can act!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Each contestant will throw two aeroplanes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: After you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. [plane loops up and falls at her feet] Oh god!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Angela's first throw, terrible. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [fake throws and drops plane] Oh! Oh man! It slipped out of my hand, what a whiff. Ah, how'd that happen? God. [Angela smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: We want you to win. Dwight told me about your situation. It's such a pity. Use the money wisely. [Angela looks disgusted]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't you dare tank this. [Dwight throws plane far, Angela fake throws and drops her plane]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And we have a winner. And it's Dwight. And it is everyone because this is over.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Two grand huh? I know a guy who can turn that into eight hundred dollars. And it's me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [To Esther] Well, I guess you needed the money more than me huh? Use it wisely.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I was disappointed in Dwight today. He showed a weakness that was unbecoming. Even if he did do it for me. I don't need pity and I don't need charity. I have my dignity and that's enough. And as long as I have that, I'll be ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know this was really weird, and it was really hard. But I think we're making progress. So I'm really sorry that I have to go but let's keep at this. Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. [intense moment where Jim leaves and Pam seems conflicted. She notices his umbrella and runs out to follow him]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim! [hands him umbrella]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright, have a good trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! [Runs after her and looks into her eyes] I... [hugs her tightly, Pam doesn't hug back]

Quote.Speaker: Pastor
Quote.Text: [Flashback to Jim & Pam's wedding] Love suffers long and is kind. It is not proud. Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. Love never fails. [Pam hugs Jim back finally] And now these three remain: Faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love. [Pam kisses Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love you.
